align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2216998"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2216998#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2214066" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2214066" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="synthesaize"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2136298"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2136298.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="synthesaize" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2214066ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2214066" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2136298">synthesaize</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-10">07/10/24 08:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Something about it makes this smell heavenly</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2214066"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2214066#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2208672" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2208672" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kiwigoddess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523875"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1523875.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kiwigoddess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2208672ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2208672" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523875">Kiwigoddess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-04">07/04/24 23:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not having had any experience with juniper berries, I trawled through all the other reviews about this fragrance to see what others said. Not a single person stated it was peppery. This is insanely peppery on me and not in a good way. After about 4 hours or maybe even more, it dissipated and became powdery and sweet but holy geebus batman, that spicy black pepper opening is enough to clear ya nostrils if you're clogged up with the flu. Although I do like the dry down, I don't think I can cope with the peppery opening. It may not be like that for anyone else but just be aware that it could potentially go that way on you if you haven't sampled it. Absolutely not a safe blind buy. I don't find this fragrance linear at all but rather a shapeshifter. Due to the heavy peppery scent at the beginning, I find it quite masculine but the dry down more feminine. If you're looking for a potential chameleon, this fragrance could possibly fulfill that need.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2208672"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2208672#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2207873" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2207873" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="withered.dreams"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="withered.dreams" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Body-Tender-17320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Body Tender"title="Body Tender"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2207873ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2207873" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321357">withered.dreams</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-04">07/04/24 05:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was sure I would end up liking one of their bestsellers, such as Philosykos, Do Son or Tam Dao because they're bestsellers for a reason until I tried Orpheon.<br />
This fragrance made me feel comforted, like a warm hug. It works well for both day and night, lingers close with surprisingly good lasting power even in a very unpredictable India weather. I don't get a lot of compliments because I make efforts to smell nice all the time, but this has garnered compliments. A friend of mine loved it so much that she ended up getting a bottle of this as well. It also made me get another bottle at Paris duty-free since I was working my way through it very quickly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2207873"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2207873#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2206558" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2206558" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kloobnika"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/125376"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.125376.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kloobnika" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2206558ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2206558" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/125376">kloobnika</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-02">07/02/24 22:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I had to keep only one perfume from my collection this would be it. For me Orpheon is absolutely perfect. It's cozy, clean, elegant. You can wear it all times of the year and would fit any aesthetic and outfit. You must try this if you're a fan of juniper and soft sweet powdery notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2206558"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2206558#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2202186" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2202186" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nanax991"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850043"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1850043.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nanax991" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Musc-Ravageur-1801.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1801.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musc Ravageur"title="Musc Ravageur"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2202186ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2202186" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850043">Nanax991</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-28">06/28/24 11:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought it because A: I liked the scent, B: I love Diptyque and C: I wanted it on my shelf. And I adore Fleur de Peau, but somehow I end up using Orpheon most of the time. It's a very versatile fragrance and so easy to wear. It works so well in summer, I'm really impressed. To me it smells like what a damp, cold forest ground feels like. Perfectly unisex, gets a bit powdery on me after a while. It may seem linear at first, but it changes a lot throughout the day. Sometimes I wonder and then realise that it's Orpheon. <br />
<br />
Longevity and sillage are okay. I hope it will become stronger over time.<br />
  <br />
10 out of 10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2202186"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2202186#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2200225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2200225" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Johnny Madison"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889501"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1889501.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Johnny Madison" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Andrea-Maack/Soft-Tension-39036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soft Tension"title="Soft Tension"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2200225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2200225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889501">Johnny Madison</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-26">06/26/24 13:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am quite shocked that the Perfume Guy (on YouTube) claims this fragrance to be boring and nothing special, as I find it incredibly unique and refined. I have had my nose on 1,000's of perfumes and never have I experienced the scent profile that Orpheon has captured. It is so beautiful, deep and well blended. The juniper opening is fresh and uplifting and then comes the powdery sweet, woody jasmine. Undeniably gorgeous, easy to wear, and as many have stated below, signature scent worthy. I have this fragrance in the solid format which is a bit more linear then the EDP, but a full bottle of the perfume is on its way from Nose Paris boutique; after testing it many times at the department store and also spending time with a handful of 2ml samples from their store. So clean, elegant, mature yet modern... I could wear Orpheon in any setting and feel polished and confident. One of Diptyque's best offerings and a standout among the world of niche fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2200225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2200225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2192981" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2192981" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scentedddiary"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1356152"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1356152.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scentedddiary" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2192981ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2192981" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1356152">scentedddiary</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-19">06/19/24 07:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orpheon is fleur de peau's younger, cheeky brother. They share a similar cocooning effect on the skin but orpheon is somehow fresher, almost... crisp? Melancholic like a fall afternoon walk after the rain. Old, modern, both and neither at the same time - a beauty that transcends time. Simply dreamy. Fabric softener but make it Dyptique.<br />
<br />
[I don't know why but I always imagine orpheon as worn by a girl in her late 20s-early 30s strolling through the streets of Seongsu - or Yeonnam, Sinsa, any hip neighborhood in Seoul would do. She strictly wears minimal monochrome looks paired with eclectic accessories - big square glasses, a collection of funky charms on her bag. Art book in one hand, half empty cup of iced coffee in the other (no sugar, duh). Exuding coolness at every step but, weirdly enough, it never looks like she's trying hard. Effortless. Like it's second nature. I SOOOO want to be her. Ughhhh]</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2192981"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2192981#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2189418" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2189418" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="k@triin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1643835"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1643835.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="k@triin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2189418ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2189418" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1643835">k@triin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 16:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’m honestly not a fan of diptyque, all the other fragrances that i have tried were too green for my taste but orpheon&gt;&gt;<br />
I’m really picky with perfumes, my preferences change all the time, i rarely stick to one fragrance longer than a week and i’m rarely impressed but not with orpheon. i got a sample randomly from a little boutique and i fell in love.<br />
orpheon is unique, everyone says it’s a signature scent material and it is. it’s popular yet quite unknown. it’s clean and fresh yet slightly sweet, deep and woody. one guy complimented me saying i smell clean in the best way. and it’s true. i love the vibes I’m getting wearing it. soft fresh forest fairy mixed with dark smokey jazz club diva with a cigarette in her hand. it’s truly became part of me. <br />
lasts for ages. i found a shirt i haven’t worn for over a year, it still smelled like orpheon!!!! <br />
repurchase for the rest of my life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2189418"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2189418#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2187968" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2187968" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="deguempe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1805390"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="deguempe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Lira-11801.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11801.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lira"title="Lira"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2187968ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2187968" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1805390">deguempe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-14">06/14/24 08:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this way back and didn't think much of it. Never really had to urge to wear this one because all I could initially smell was powder ad wipol. Then a few days back I got a random craving for this scent and sprayed it on me, and fell head over heels in love. I now smell the delicate, mystical, foresty woody goodness some people online were talking about. To me, it opens with a burst of ice cold juniper berries, followed by woods and gentle powderiness. In some perfumes, jasmine, and white florals in general, really bug me, but here jasmine really adds to the perfume's delicateness. This is absolutely a woodland fairy type of perfume.<br />
<br />
I wear perfume every day, but I don't usually get complimented since all my friends and family know I'm into perfume and always smell nice, but this one did it. It got dozens of my family members asking what scent I was wearing on a family get-together yesterday. I purchased my full bottle today along with the solid perfume. I find their scent profiles very similar, except for the solid one being more linear, which is normal for a solid perfume. <br />
<br />
The projection and sillage could be better, but that's just what you get with Diptyque. Still, being an EDP, it's one of the better performing ones. I find this scent projects for about 2h, then sits close to the skin and stays there for a long while. Some days I can still smell it faintly on my skin the next morning. An absolute love from me. And a perfume worthy of being a signature scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2187968"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2187968#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2182372" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2182372" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ethelcainwearingorpheon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2160244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ethelcainwearingorpheon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2182372ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2182372" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160244">ethelcainwearingorpheon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-08">06/08/24 16:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It may be somewhat biased to read a review from an account called ethelcainwearingorpheon on orpheon but here goes nothing:<br />
<br />
This is the best fragrance by Diptyque. Let's get the basics out of the way: has an alluring sillage with very good projection and will politely brush the noses of those in the room. Fills the room but doesn't occupy it. When I say the best I also mean complexion, execution of lore/idea to a perfume. Diptyque's artistry really peaked here in my opinion and it's hard to beat anything like this. The Diptyque sale's assosciate in their Amsterdam boutique explained the lore of how it was inspired by the old club neighboring the original boutique in paris. Powder from the women powdering their noses, and the jasmin fleeting from their perfumes. The men are drinking gin in a parisian bar, furnished with slightly dampened wood and they used pine cleaner very often.<br />
<br />
It's a simple note composition and I bet even the blindest of noses could identify the notes in what they're smelling if you tell them. There are juniper berries, cold and fresh but the fragrance is a warm hug. There is jasmin and tonka bean but this is a very clean scent. There's powdery notes, which is a theme people tend to assosciate with older fragrances but this is not that. This is powdery the way a chanel compact powder smells, with the sponge they deliver after its been used over and over. If your mother has a powder compact she's held onto for a while go smell it, this is that kind of powdery note but in the cleanest sharpest most elegant way possible. The cedar and tonka bean are the powerhouse of this fragrance as it dries down. Imagine what a luxorious hotel lobby would smell like, but then in a wood shop, where someone's making a drink with Hendrick's and they spilled some on the yet to be varnished wood and the smell sets in. <br />
<br />
This fragrance has gotten me compliments from so many kinds of people that it really does fit all the categories like the previous comment is saying. This is the finest example of french perfumery's take on woody and floral. This is Tygar's older family member (I'm not saying brother/sister because this fragrance swims in androgyny). Coniferous, captivating, refreshing, polite, inviting, office friendly, sexy, ethel cain might wear this to church.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2182372"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2182372#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2181132" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2181132" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TBonetheFella"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1710835"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1710835.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TBonetheFella" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jorum-Studio/Spiritcask-79477.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79477.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spiritcask"title="Spiritcask"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2181132ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2181132" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1710835">TBonetheFella</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-07">06/07/24 10:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There aren’t many fragrances out there that I truly think could cover every conceivable situation you wear fragrance in, this is one of the few.<br />
<br />
As soon as you spray this on you’re met with a blast of ice cold juniper berries, clean jasmine, and an overdose of freshly cut cedar wood. Then after this cold and professional opening, is when the true magic happens as this slightly sweet powder begins to slowly swell and grow. After about 4 or so hours in, when the cedar, powder, slight tonka sweetness, and clean white florals sing in harmony, it settles in and doesn’t change much. <br />
<br />
Wow. Clean and professional yet comforting and casual. I will say, you have to like woody/powdery fragrances to really love this, but I struggle to find anyone who wouldn’t like this. In the air it has a faint baby powder like vibe to it, but that’s not to diminish or discredit its nuance as my mind just makes the connection due to the overdose of clean powder in here. My current favorite from the house is either Ilio or Tam Dao EDP (depending on the season), but this might give both of them a run for their money. Will have to invest in a decant soon to see if I get the full bottle.<br />
<br />
Very good performance, still testing projection.<br />
<br />
9.5/10. Truly signature scent worthy.<br />
<br />
Song vibe - Recipe by Jackie’s Boy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2181132"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2181132#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2177150" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2177150" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mea194"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1966632"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1966632.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mea194" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Do-Son-Eau-de-Parfum-49098.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49098.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Do Son Eau de Parfum"title="Do Son Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2177150ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2177150" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1966632">mea194</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-03">06/03/24 18:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is most definitely a popular one from Diptyque so I was really excited to try it. There is a strong woodsy scent alongside a tart almost cold smelling juniper berry. It is ethereal smelling. To be honest, at first it comes off very similar to a nice men’s cologne, but as it dries down the tonka and powdery notes come in more making the woods I picture in my head become foggy and more enchanted. This is one that I have to wear for a long time to really get the transformation of it. I would definetly recommend sampling this one first before buying! An interesting scent for sure, if you are a fan of wood, powder, and tart juniper berry notes then this is for you! It took me one journey for sure! I appreciate this scent for what it is though and urge you to try it for yourself!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2177150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2177150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2174910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2174910" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maleficent&#039;s cotton candy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461326"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1461326.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maleficent&#039;s cotton candy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Sycomore-Eau-de-Parfum-41780.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41780.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"title="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2174910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2174910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461326">Maleficent&#039;s cotton candy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-01">06/01/24 15:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So good. I can’t pick out any notes in particular, but it smells clean and unisex. I sprayed this on my shirt yesterday, drove two hours, changed to swim, ate then put my shirt back on and still got a compliment on this fragrance at the store on the way home.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2174910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2174910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2174040" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2174040" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="varahsue"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2145699"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2145699.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="varahsue" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-7-Virtues/Santal-Vanille-67204.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67204.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Vanille"title="Santal Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2174040ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2174040" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2145699">varahsue</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 19:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I took the train from California to Chicago.  It was two and half days of travel, non-stop, and I wore this perfume.  I did not reapply, and I could still smell this stuff on me when I arrived in Chicago.  The longevity is fantastic and the sillage is not overpowering. I am loving this scent more and more, every time I wear it.  I did not like it initially, because the opening notes with juniper is a little overpowering and it smells of a typical fresh scent.  The dry down is what keeps drawing me in and I think it's what makes this perfume unique.  It is powdery, clean, cozy, woody, and I get a tiny hint of metal.  This scent would smell lovely when layered with leathery or tobacco perfumes.  If this scent is dependent on your skin chemistry, I am so happy that I came across this one.  It makes me smile every time I smell it. 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2174040"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2174040#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2173416" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2173253" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vminie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vminie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2173253ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2173253" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906">vminie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 04:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like how clean and crisp this is! This is what I imagined L'eau Papier to smell like! Powdery with cool and clean scent of paper. I keep smelling my wrist because it was quite calming. It dries down to this cozy, creamy but unscented soap from a hotel I've stayed in the past. I think the cedar will smell stronger in winter time. Have yet to test this out when sweating. But I don't think the scent is offensive and the powdery finish will still permeate.<br />
<br />
On days I feel like I want to add depth to this scent, I layer it with other perfumes and it really blends well. Today, I layered it with Maison Margiela Replica When the Rain Stops and it smells akin to the dry down of YSL Libre but less musky</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Pretty bottle. A very dry scent, it's really aromatic and medicinal and not sweet at all. Makes a lovely scent bubble around you and lasts. I love it but it just doesn't fit me to wear it- needs the right personality imo! I have a full bottle for sale in Aus if anyone is looking</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2156991"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2156991#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2156514" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2156514" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Coppersulfate"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898638"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1898638.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Coppersulfate" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Fleur-de-Peau-Eau-de-Parfum-48681.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48681.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"title="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2156514ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2156514" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898638">Coppersulfate</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-15">05/15/24 05:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Once again another diptyque i love. I dont have much to say about this one besides the fact that its extremely unique. Even after sampling it multiple times i wasnt able to fully comprehend this scent, but im in love! Diptyque always has a powderiness in their fragrances, and this one goes all out in that department. You dont really smell one note more than the other, its all about the end result. Surprisingly, this leans SLIIGHTLY more masculine than most of their fragrances. Its definitely unisex and not a masculine scent, but it leans just ever so slightly masculine. Idk why. It has amazing longevity, im able to smell it a full day after spraying it on my hand. Projection is lacking but no one buys diptyque to make a statement, so i dont mind. It has greenish nuances but its not a bitter green fresh fragrance. Its cold and warm at the same time. Great year round scent and isnt similar to anything ive smelled before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2156514"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2156514#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2155028" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2155028" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="parfumparfan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1111549"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="parfumparfan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chloe/Cedrus-57246.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57246.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cedrus"title="Cedrus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2155028ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2155028" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1111549">parfumparfan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-13">05/13/24 17:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love juniper. It smells so crisp and almost medicinal. This isn't really a juniper scent though, despite it being pretty well-represented. To me it's a very fruity wood scent, I think likely due to the tonka. I love how the pointy sharpness of the juniper (really intense yet very fleeting at the top of every whiff) and the edgy sharpness of the cedar (strong, sleek line through every breath) are mellowed out with the rest of the notes.<br />
<br />
 It's unique, and full-bottle worthy if you like tonka or are in the market for an interesting woodsy fragrance and don't want to go smokey woodsy or resinous. Monster lasting power--I get a full 24 hrs on fabric, 12 on skin, with good sillage. It can be cloying in the heat due to the tonka, it isn't refreshing or fresh so I think it'll probably be a fall/winter fragrance. <br />
<br />
I see this more for daytime as it's not particularly alluring or seductive, but instead reassuring and confident. On skin for me it leans a bit feminine for me but on fabric or paper it is truly unisex. I don't get grandma but it does smell classic/posh. It gives me blazer vibes or loafers instead of heels/trendy sneakers. <br />
<br />
This is probably my favorite Diptyque fragrance. <br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2155028"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2155028#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2150460" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2150460" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="temporalgrace"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/515767"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.515767.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="temporalgrace" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/She-Was-An-Anomaly-56994.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56994.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="She Was An Anomaly"title="She Was An Anomaly"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2150460ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2150460" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/515767">temporalgrace</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-09">05/09/24 07:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very pretty. I don't find it to be "grandma-ish," but it does have a vintage feel that I suspect is leading other reviewers to get that impression. It feels more mature than I expected due to the soapy quality of the jasmine. With that being said it feels soft and feminine in a confident way. It's fresh but not light, sweet but not too sweet, and has just enough woodiness to keep it grounded. It could be worn either as a date night fragrance or to a book club meeting depending on how heavily you spray. I find it likeable but it isn't a love, so I don't plan to purchase a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2150460"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2150460#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2143148" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2143148" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mhobol"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293338"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293338.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mhobol" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Antoine-Barrois/Ganymede-54720.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54720.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ganymede"title="Ganymede"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2143148ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2143148" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293338">mhobol</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-02">05/02/24 05:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Best "grandma scent" I have tried, grandma meaning chyphre. I forgot to check if this was a chyphre before I ordered a sample, cus I know I just cannot pull this style off. It just feels too mature for me and I am 35.<br />
<br />
It is a nice, very white floral fragrance, a great spring/summer scent. On me I don't get any wood.<br />
<br />
I see a lot of people find this office friendly. Not for me. One spray in the office made me nauseaous. 2 hours in, projection was still strong and people commented on it. I think this is better outside.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2143148"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2143148#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2138874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2138874" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brokesta911"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1221404"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1221404.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="brokesta911" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Shalimar-Souffle-d-Oranger-54098.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54098.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shalimar Souffle d'Oranger"title="Shalimar Souffle d'Oranger"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2138874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2138874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1221404">brokesta911</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-28">04/28/24 06:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Diptyque Orpheon (2021) - jasmine patchouli - One of the last creations of #olivierpescheux and one of the most comforting scents created. Upon first wear, I get a white musk &amp; juniper berry accord, but probing deeper, it’s not just musk that I’m appreciating. Starts with the cleanest Jasmine, no hints of animalic indoles combined with pine-like Juniper berries. At its heart I get a supporting cast of Magnolia, Rose, and Ylang-ylang - powdery and warm. At its base, I sense Patchouli and Amber. I don’t know what oils does Diptyque fragrance house have access to, but this Patchouli isn’t damp earth-like, but more white chocolate, reminding me of classics such as Chanel no 5. Close to the skin, but persistent. A modern classic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2138874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2138874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137683" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1686988">jaehyuns</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-27">04/27/24 00:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i know tobacco isn't listed on here but i'm sure my nose can detect it. this smells like a smoker in the hottest and sexiest way possible, the tobacco isn't too overpowering and it's balanced very well with jasmine and cedar. the dry down is slightly sweet and powdery and the tobacco is mostly gone by then. this was not a love at first sniff but i'm glad i gave it a second chance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2137683"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2137683#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130714" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130714" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ccrockstar11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1849719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ccrockstar11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Parfum-49100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130714ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130714" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1849719">ccrockstar11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 12:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening very much reminds me of bug spray and cedar, which is a scent that brings to my childhood. It very quickly dries down and the flowery and powdery notes take over. My partner says this is a "grandma scent," which I can see where he's coming from, but I greatly appreciate the comforting and naturey scents that I love Diptyque for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2130714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2130714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130599" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130599" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="L&#039;&eacute;gyptienne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1595463.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="L&#039;&eacute;gyptienne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Celine/Black-Tie-57925.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57925.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Tie"title="Black Tie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130599ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130599" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595463">L&#039;&eacute;gyptienne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 10:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How can i describe this fragrance?!<br />
it's a HUG or HOME, can't find another word to describe it, somehow it's able to giving this warm and soozing feeling when someone wisper to your ear " everything gonna be ok"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2130599"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2130599#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2126167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2126167" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fick von Nacht und Tag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1660350"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1660350.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fick von Nacht und Tag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2126167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2126167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1660350">Fick von Nacht und Tag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-16">04/16/24 03:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's something similar to Elizabeth Arden Blue Grass. No, not the same, but Vintage type clean and powdery scents with noticeable jasmine and also vanilla/tonka and cedar in the dry down.<br />
Both are very interesting and unisex, only Blue Grass costs almost nothing compared to Orphéon.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2126167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2126167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123518" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123518" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jasmine27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862724"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1862724.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jasmine27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/L-Eau-Papier-78658.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78658.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau Papier"title="L'Eau Papier"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123518ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123518" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862724">jasmine27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 08:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this one smells like a very luxurious soap, and to be honest, i don’t get anything more on my skin. it’s very different from what i imagined.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
