padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033209" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nomi00"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1881741"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1881741.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nomi00" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Skin-35244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Skin"title="Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033209ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033209" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1881741">nomi00</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-16">01/16/24 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>easy to wear but slightly more masculine than what i had imagined. clean, fresh but also aromatic, almost like a pine. my first association was fancy car freshener from a gentleman's lexus or something, but not in a bad way. my dad also really likes this one</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2033209"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2033209#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2027743" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2027743" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Noir"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1775729"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1775729.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Noir" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pernoire/Otimo-97099.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97099.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Otimo"title="Otimo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2027743ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2027743" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1775729">Noir</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-11">01/11/24 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nice soapy, clean unisex fragrance embedded with cedar and powdery notes. Performance, as with most Diptyque fragrances, is average, but the projection on this is pretty good, while the longevity is standard.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2027743"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2027743#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2024837" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2024837" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="L&#039;heure exquise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1965132"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1965132.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="L&#039;heure exquise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/H24-65147.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65147.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="H24"title="H24"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2024837ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2024837" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1965132">L&#039;heure exquise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-08">01/08/24 17:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After getting into fragrances a few years ago, I finally gave Diptyque a try. I tested about a dozen at Bloomingdale's and when I smelled Orphéon, I purchased it immediately.<br />
<br />
The opening of this fragrance took me back to a scent I hadn't smelled since I was three years old in the Netherlands. A very clean, floral almost detergent-like smell -- fresh, green, woody and bright with some darkness and moodiness to it without being to chemical-y. It was a very emotional buy for me. Every day I take a whiff of it just to bring a smile to my face. If I could encapsulate the opening of it with all of its juniper berry goodness, I would. But the dry down loses that juniper berry and transforms into an intimate powdery note with a dry jasmine base which feels classy and elegant -- it reminds me of an art gallery on the upper east side of NYC. Towards the end, taking a long sniff, I smell a faintly hint of tobacco -- like the fresh part of a new pack of cigarettes -- with some citrus and still that dry jasmine and powder base. Altogether, the fragrance is elegant, classy and subtle.<br />
<br />
I wish that the fragrance had a greater sillage. I find that after just 4 - 5 hours I can hardly smell it on my skin without bringing my hand right to my nose and sniffing. However, my hands have been very dry lately, so I'll be trying it out with more moisturized skin to see if that makes a different (so far, today, it has made a difference for the better). It could also be due to the way the fragrance interacts with my skin. I find that I can still faintly smell it on my clothes the following day.<br />
<br />
I am used to head-turning fragrances (like Le Labo, Byredo and Orto Parisi), and love talking to people about them, but I'm learning to appreciate the beauty and intimacy of Orphéon.  I truly love this fragrance and am consiering making it my signature scent, but only wish that the opening notes lasted longer and that I could smell it longer throughout the day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2024837"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2024837#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2023951" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2023951" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kaleo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951650"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kaleo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2023951ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2023951" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951650">kaleo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-07">01/07/24 20:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i have mixed feelings honestly. the opening to this was more woody and a little spicy, which is what i expected to be more prominent overall, but it changed almost completely as it dried. it turned very powdery, but a fresh and clean powdery, and i could smell some jasmine in their too. the dry-down was feminine leaning compared to the opening (which is what threw me off a little), at least on my skin. the longevity is amazing though, and you could smell it from someone probably within arm's length. definitely not a bad fragrance, but i do suggest to try this out before if you intend on buying</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2023951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2023951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2023087" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2023087" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ardentdemoness"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521323"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1521323.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ardentdemoness" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-26127.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26127.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso "title="Narciso "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2023087ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2023087" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521323">ardentdemoness</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-06">01/06/24 22:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 1𝙢𝙡 𝙨𝙖𝙢𝙥𝙡𝙚 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙨𝙖𝙡𝙚 𝙤𝙧 𝙚𝙭𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙜𝙚, 𝙙𝙢 𝙢𝙚 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪’𝙧𝙚 𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙩𝙚𝙙!<br />
<br />
This hit quite close to home on a testing strip. I’m looking for an unconventional woody masculine fragrance and this was a prominent candidate except for one thing: it turned painfully feminine on my skin.  Which is unfortunate because Orphéon was unlike anything I’ve smelled before. Warm, aromatic and clean. Dry woods softened by powdery notes, instead of sweetness that ruins the dryness. A refreshing take!<br />
<br />
Orphéon lasted 3-4 hours on my skin (typical Diptyque longevity), with quite strong silage comparing to the rest of the house. I’d say about 4 sprays should be enough to leave a trail and have everyone within talking length to smell you. Leaning masculine but test before buy, great for any season during nighttime. I highly encourage everyone to test Orphéon out at least once in your perfume journey.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2023087"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2023087#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2021023" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2021023" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Evie01"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1676821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Evie01" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2021023ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2021023" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1676821">Evie01</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 04:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tried this on a testing strip<br />
<br />
It’s a very fresh and clean gin scent with a powdery skin-like background on paper, and I’m excited to try it on my skin. Really refreshing for summer! If you enjoy Chanel no 19 you will probably enjoy this one, and I think that both women and men can rock this<br />
I think Diptyque has the best niche fragrances on the market, they are well blended and have a fair price</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2021023"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2021023#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2020332" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2020332" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alexkng"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1938346"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alexkng" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Pearl-Oud-31395.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31395.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pearl Oud"title="Pearl Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2020332ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2020332" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1938346">alexkng</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-04">01/04/24 14:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening is fresh and spicy, woody and comforting. But after 15-30 minutes all I am getting is a linear scent of diluted sweet black tea served in school canteen in South East Asia.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2020332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2020332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2019774" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2019774" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smf13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816750"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="smf13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2019774ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2019774" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816750">smf13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-04">01/04/24 04:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orpheon is stunningly beautiful. Fresh and green but also dark and warm. It feels retro in a 60’s-70’s men’s cologne way but is completely modern. Androgynous rather than unisex feels like a better description. The green freshness comes from the juniper, which I find enchanting in comparison to the usual citrus notes that are often leaned on in fresh fragrances. I also think this would layer well with others; something smokey or wood heavy if you want to make it more masculine or something vanilla if you want to make it more feminine. I can wear this year round, it’s as nice in the heat as in cool weather. It meshes well with my skin chemistry, I often get compliments when I wear it. Longevity and sillage are good for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2019774"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2019774#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2017309" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2017309" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aspirina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/128870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.128870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aspirina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Eaudemoiselle-de-Givenchy-Ambre-Velours-18920.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18920.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eaudemoiselle de Givenchy Ambre Velours"title="Eaudemoiselle de Givenchy Ambre Velours"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2017309ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2017309" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/128870">aspirina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-01">01/01/24 18:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very interesting scent. The juniper and cedar keep pulling the the strings against a flowery powdery background. It feels so androgynous. I don't understand this scent. It is very moody and somewhat arrogant, it feels green, powdery and sweet, masculine and feminine at the same time. There is something that keeps bringing this 70's vibe, little bit grandma, little bit hippie, little bit intellectual college professor of ambiguous tendencies...<br />
I don't know. It is a rare beauty that I don't think I can wear. But it mesmerizes anyway.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2017309"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2017309#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2014680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2014680" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marshmallowmami"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1917543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="marshmallowmami" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15261.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Beach Walk"title="Beach Walk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2014680ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2014680" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917543">marshmallowmami</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-29">12/29/23 19:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i'm gonna keep it real, i have no idea what juniper berries smell like but i don't need to because this scent is divine. TWICE's jihyo wears it and it's one of her empties, so i just had to find out what mother smelled like. <br />
<br />
i can see this being a somewhat polarizing scent + not safe blind buy. it initially starts off loud (which i'm guessing might be the juniper), so i wasn't sure if my "like" could turn into a "love", but it did. it dries down into a clean, powdery scent that is genuinely signature scent-worthy. additionally, and very important, i perceive this to be a feminine-leaning scent. it's not masculine to me, it's powerful. it lasts longer than any perfume i've tried, a little over 7 hours. a bit steep price-wise, but full bottle worthy for sure. a mature and fresh scent, suitable for day or night.<br />
<br />
edit: the projection is crazy though. i don't need more than two spritz on each pulse point of my neck. it creates an insane scent bubble, and it can be a bit overwhelming. starts more masc, but the dry-down is a lot more powdery and feminine for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2014680"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2014680#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2007530" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2007530" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KKDYLM"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862153"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1862153.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KKDYLM" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2007530ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2007530" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862153">KKDYLM</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-21">12/21/23 20:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a huge fan of juniper berries and cedar in my fragrances, and although this didn't disappoint, I can't seem to get past the overwhelming pepper-ness. I ended up buying a 5ml tester from SS after trying this in the store and I am constantly going back and forth. If I could find a smoother, less stringent version of this, it would be a favorite.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2007530"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2007530#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2004919" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2004919" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="M1K&pound;"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1778259.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="M1K&pound;" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Ebene-Fume-69008.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69008.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ébène Fumé"title="Ébène Fumé"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2004919ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2004919" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778259">M1K&pound;</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-18">12/18/23 22:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orphéon is an unusual but beautiful scent. Clean, enticing, and strangely addictive, it has become my signature scent after a few wears. It is equal parts light and dark; inviting and perplexing. Its performance is a mystery as I cannot smell it for more than half an hour, but others have smelled it 6+ hours after I've applied it. A perfect signature for someone who finds traditional, shower gel-reminiscent scents too boring for everyday wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2004919"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2004919#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2003407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2003407" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kestrele"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1864054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1864054.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kestrele" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Princess-90174.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90174.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Princess"title="Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2003407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2003407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1864054">kestrele</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-17">12/17/23 04:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wouldn't recommend if you don't love juniper. Actually, if you're not a fan of evergreen/herbal/sharp sorts of notes in general-- mint, pine, juniper, pepper, etc-- I think you should avoid this. When combined with the powdery note, it smells sort of like a freshly groomed grandpa. It's medicinal, dusty, and masculine-leaning. I suppose it's different for everyone, but as for me, I'm not a fan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="2003407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=2003407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1998705" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1998705" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PapaTLooch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361586"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1361586.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PapaTLooch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1998705ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1998705" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361586">PapaTLooch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-11">12/11/23 14:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Super clean, fresh, powdery, luxury fabric softener/laundry detergent. My wife says it smells very woody and spicy. It's unusual in that it seems to smell different to everyone. The combination of the wood, light florals and juniper is quite soapy and pleasing. I do smell a touch of patchouli in the base but it’s a clean patchouli, not earthy. It's very pleasant. I sprayed this on my jacket collar and hung it in my closet. Over a month passed until I wore that jacket and I can still smell Orpheon on it. Go easy on it. 2 sprays is enough. It's potent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1998705"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1998705#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1997515" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tanaC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.75237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tanaC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1997515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1997515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/75237">tanaC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-10">12/10/23 05:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orphéon Eau de Parfum Diptyque<br />
(Store test)<br />
<br />
This note break down here looks so authentic.<br />
I can smell sweeten cedar wood powder.<br />
With White floral, mild sweeten support and some sparkle from Juniper berry.<br />
<br />
Very nice clean scent from Orphéon.<br />
Not really sure is this worth an expensive price tag but all ingredient seems authentic here.<br />
<br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1997515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1997515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1996829" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1996829" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="saranyaskumar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351062"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1351062.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="saranyaskumar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ex-Nihilo/Blue-Talisman-84224.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84224.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blue Talisman"title="Blue Talisman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1996829ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1996829" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351062">saranyaskumar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-09">12/09/23 10:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Absolute signature scent worthy. Quite polarising but I love it. It's very comforting but a little screechy at the same time. It's very refreshing, sparkly, cold, and clean smelling. Not clean as in soapy but medically clean.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1996829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1996829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1996583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1996583" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cheleine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1349744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cheleine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1996583ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1996583" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744">cheleine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-09">12/09/23 02:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How does one try to describe Orpheon? <br />
Familiar yet distant, like a memory. Something that smells like a romanticised version of how nature and humanity would smell in its purest, kindest form. The smell of the first snow in a forest and the sun warming the atmosphere right before it melts. <br />
At the same time…it feels like it’s out of this world as well. Like how the skin of a nymph or a fairy would smell like… So enchanting and enchanted! <br />
<br />
I see many people saying it leans masculine, others say feminine. For me, it’s perfectly androgynous. And it smells different based on your skin chemistry. <br />
First time I tried it was on paper and I was put off by that bitter green piny opening with the juniper berries.<br />
But wait…within minutes the scents softens up and blooms into something so beautiful and magical.<br />
It doesn’t smell perfumey at all, it’s very natural.<br />
<br />
The only fault I can find with Orpheon is that Diptyque marketed it as something completely different as to what most people have in mind when they put their nose on it. A jazz bar? In the 60s? In Paris? I understand and respect the team had a specific imagery and idea in mind and they wanted to pay tribute to an important memory for the founders of the brand, but unfortunately…the rest of us…we can’t feel it, we can’t really understand it. Where’s the smoke? The booze? The leather? The naughtiness, the darkness, the nocturnal beauty. For me this screams nature, cleanness, baby’s breath, human skin after it has been caressed and softly kissed, comfort but all done in an elevated and unique way that takes you on a majestic, yet very personal journey. <br />
<br />
It’s an experience and an underrated masterpiece from the house of Diptyque. Try it on skin. <br />
I see similarities with Fleur de Peau, L’eau Papier, Eau Duelle in the way that they exude a similar feeling. <br />
<br />
P.s. I started with testing it, then the solid (that unfortunately has zero projection on me) and I just ordered a full bottle. There’s something very special about this scent and I want to explore it even more. It feels weirdly comforting and soothing like rubbing a natural healing ointment or balm on you to feel better when you’re feeling under the weather. It has aromatherapy benefits for sure. It’s not obviously cheery or uplifting but feels very cathartic in my experience.<br />
For all seasons and occasions.<br />
It becomes part of you and your natural scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1996583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1996583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994320" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1994320" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="markvel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1137924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1137924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="markvel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Perfumer-H/Rain-Cloud-36265.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36265.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rain Cloud"title="Rain Cloud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1994320ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1994320" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1137924">markvel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-06">12/06/23 14:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really though I'm gonna love this one but unfortunately it smells dated to me<br />
It's very versatile and can be used for everyday and every occasion which is a big plus</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1994320"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1994320#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1990797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1990797" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JNlangley"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1912954"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1912954.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JNlangley" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1990797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1990797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1912954">JNlangley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-02">12/02/23 14:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's powdery but sweet, woody but clean. You could potentially see this fragrance as more 'mature' but I don't think it tips the balance for me. <br />
<br />
I love how wearable this fragrance is. I've been looking for something a little lighter than Eau Duelle for the warmer months and this is definitely my next big bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1990797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1990797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1990593" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1990593" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BeauBleue"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223146"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1223146.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BeauBleue" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Le-Parfum-61856.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61856.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male Le Parfum"title="Le Male Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1990593ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1990593" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223146">BeauBleue</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-02">12/02/23 10:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orphéon has quickly become my signature fragrance. It’s certainly a masterpiece - suitable year-round, any occasion, for daily wear. I don’t find it linear at all, it’s just very, very well blended. <br />
<br />
From spray to dry-down, there is a ‘journey’ here. On my skin it opens with the non-citrus fresh juniper peppery-ness, then there’s a really smooth but  realistic jasmine for a couple hours before drying down to what I can only describe as a unisex modern, non-rose based chypre. I don’t get lots of tonka/vanilla but I think they help to smooth things out. It has similar vibes to Tom Ford’s White Patchouli, but it’s nowhere near as strong and heady. <br />
<br />
If I were to give it a colour it would be almond white. It’s very distinctive, and not as simple a fragrance as the marketing or note breakdown would have you believe, so I don’t think it’s a safe blind buy. That said, it’s pretty versatile. It lasts well on my skin, around 6-8 hours. It’s beautiful, effortless, chic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1990593"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1990593#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1990082" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1990082" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Caramel lady"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1359719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Caramel lady" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1990082ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1990082" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359719">Caramel lady</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-01">12/01/23 15:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok I’m back again.<br />
This perfume deserves a second review. <br />
<br />
It stayed on my mind since last tested and I’ve tried it again. I’ve found another “life time” perfume - this is a big deal as a minimalist.<br />
<br />
Gorgeously sophisticated, it smells smart yet cosy. <br />
This smells like someone who keeps their home clean and organised and their self-care routines are important to them. They’re polished and their well put together style looks effortless, just as this scent makes them smell. They look after themselves well and it’s evident.<br />
<br />
Earthy tones coming in from the woodiness mixed with sweetness of the jasmine and then a touch of powder that slightly mutes these notes whilst simultaneously pulling them together. The Tonka is sitting underneath what I’ve described, acting as the foundation, gently grounding this beautifully blended scent. <br />
<br />
Masculine leaning yes, but unisex enough for a girly girl to girl to wear because of what it represents.<br />
Effortless, cleanliness.<br />
<br />
It’s smells like effortlessly, clean skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1990082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1990082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1989886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1989886" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="palenovad"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1885211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1885211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="palenovad" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aesop/Marrakech-Intense-26229.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26229.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marrakech Intense"title="Marrakech Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1989886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1989886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1885211">palenovad</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-01">12/01/23 10:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I started my fragrance journey loving jasmine, but lately white florals don’t feel like me anymore. I can see myself wearing this to the theatre to see a ballet though. Fresh, elegant, suitable for everyday wear and special occasions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1989886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1989886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1985260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1985260" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JollyOlly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275761"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275761.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="JollyOlly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/James-Heeley/Menthe-Fraiche-7851.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7851.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Menthe Fraiche"title="Menthe Fraiche"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1985260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1985260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275761">JollyOlly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-25">11/25/23 17:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I mean its really basic and clean, but there is something quite interesting lurking beneath the simpleness of the scentprofile. Its quite fleeting. For me its almost identical too Laurent Mazzone aldheyx. I dont particularly love it, but I keep coming back to it, time after time again. Worth testing!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1985260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1985260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979974" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wisewizard87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1375182"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1375182.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wisewizard87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1375182">wisewizard87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-19">11/19/23 00:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This powdery perfume is just a slight more floweral version of Fleur De Peau. Still give me that grandma vibe unfortunately i already got myself a full bottle, dang. TamDao still better and more wearable to me, it has more present and depth compare to Orpheon and Fleau De Peau</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1979974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1979974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979163" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jillvee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750980"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1750980.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jillvee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Black-Vanilla-46662.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46662.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Vanilla"title="Black Vanilla"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979163ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979163" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750980">jillvee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 19:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tested this on paper and on initial spray I personally can't see it as anything I would gravitate towards wearing personally.  First spray was like the small shaped fancy floral handsoaps your grandma had that no one was allowed to use, shifting to a stinging sharp juniper and then powder. I still keep getting a weird floral, soapy quality in the background- perhaps the jasmine and powder together? To me personally it smells very dated and I can't quite picture walking around smelling like soap from my grandma's bathroom lol. Perhaps it smells different on skin but I am at the moment reserving that for another time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1979163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1979163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1974037" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1974037" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sortilege"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885678"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.885678.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sortilege" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1974037ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1974037" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885678">sortilege</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-11">11/11/23 07:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The creators of Moussel shower gel (Legrain), a best seller in France/Spain could sue Diptyque for taking its scent &amp; turning into one of their perfumes, for whether it was done deliberately or not it smells like a (fragrant) carbon copy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1974037"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1974037#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1973047" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1973047" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AinoKaroliina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1810813"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1810813.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AinoKaroliina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1973047ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1973047" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1810813">AinoKaroliina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-10">11/10/23 01:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sense the juniper berry as well as its needles in the top notes. The powdery notes are subtle at first but get stronger with time.  Jasmine is such a nice choice to use here, it brings a touch of sweetness.<br />
<br />
This starts out as simply fresh and clean, but develops into a warm and softly sweet scent.<br />
This is an easy to wear fragrance, a choice that you don't have to think too much about.<br />
<br />
When I first sprayed this on I immediately thought it was more of a masculine scent, but as the jasmine and powdery notes get more prominent it turns truly unisex. <br />
<br />
