I love the pairing of cedar and tonka bean, it's rich and dark woody.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1973047"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1973047#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1968314" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1968314" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pinkclogs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1801281"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1801281.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pinkclogs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1968314ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1968314" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1801281">pinkclogs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-04">11/04/23 04:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i went back and forth between department stores to smell this more than six times before buying, i was in such disbelief at what i was smelling. this perfume smells like doing laundry at 7am in a forest: it's clean, woody, powdery and lightly floral. every fragrance accord i love blended perfectly. each time i wear it my mum comments on how good i smell, even though the accords she likes in perfume are more spicy and fruity. my friend asked me around 6 hours after application if i was wearing perfume, because she smelled me before seeing me and recognised the scent from earlier when we had sat together. the sillage is fantastic, not loud and overpowering but the perfume will be smelled without question. it's a very chic scent, i've worn this both day and night and it seems appropriate for both. i think it's suitable to wear year-round, though i personally wouldn't wear it in summer as i prefer bright scents in summertime.<br />
<br />
in one word i would describe this as enchanting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1968314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1968314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966845" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966845" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sniffmonster"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1550148"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1550148.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sniffmonster" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966845ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966845" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1550148">sniffmonster</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 10:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can see why this scent became so popular: it's clean, fresh, and unobjectionable. I would consider it a safe blind buy if you want a light scent that doesn't sit too close to the skin but also isn't aggressively perfume-y. There is a barely-there, powdery note of incense that keeps it from being too floral. I have owned/smelled many Diptyque perfumes, and this is one of the best and most broadly accessible. Highly recommended.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1966845"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1966845#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961970" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It can be a bit chalky when applied near the nose, so I prefer to apply it on my belly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1961970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1961970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1959569" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It’s impossible that it is not listed. Very fresh in a soapy way</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1959569"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1959569#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1954720" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1954720" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumePixie87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1563263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1563263.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumePixie87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/What-We-Do-Is-Secret/Messy-Sexy-Just-Rolled-out-of-Bed-40574.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40574.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Messy Sexy Just Rolled out of Bed"title="Messy Sexy Just Rolled out of Bed"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1954720ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1954720" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1563263">PerfumePixie87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 00:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orpheon is serious and sophisticated. It opens with a burst of sharp citrus and a blast of black pepper. The dry down is woody and so powdery it’s almost dusty. I feel like this is a masculine take on a powdery perfume. It is unisex leaning masculine in my opinion. It smells chic and French and represents classic perfumery. I appreciate its beauty but don’t necessarily feel like it’s very me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1954720"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1954720#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1952294" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1952294" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="staceydtb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/897003"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.897003.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="staceydtb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Gentle-Fluidity-Gold-53401.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53401.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentle Fluidity Gold"title="Gentle Fluidity Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1952294ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1952294" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/897003">staceydtb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-15">10/15/23 05:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Effervescent juniper opening that transitions to make the other notes known. This scent changes. Some days, it's a classy cocktail followed by a sexy whisper. On other days, it's a powder bomb that challenges my olfactory. I can't hate it, though, as it's different from anything I own. The downside is either the short-lived performance - or maybe my skin soaks this up rather quickly, or I go nose-blind to it.<br />
<br />
EDIT: What witchcraft is this? The more I wear it, the more I fall for it to the point where I long for the wafts of that damned powder note. This is the kind that grows on you. Like an unlikely suitor that wins your heart.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1952294"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1952294#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1952148" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1952148" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kinnyski"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1794769"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kinnyski" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/724-75754.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75754.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="724"title="724"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1952148ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1952148" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1794769">Kinnyski</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-14">10/14/23 22:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is just something about Diptyque fragrances that makes me associate them with Supernatural beings.  Orpheon makes me think of Midsummer Nights Dream's Titania and Oberon.  It's like bathing in an enchanted lake and emerging and walking barefoot in the forest (Juniper, cedar and Jasmine).  The powdery notes and tonka being the scent of the fairy's skin.  The drydown is similar to L'Eau Papier but more woody.  I somehow associate this with evenings and L'Eau papier with daytime.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1952148"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1952148#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1950152" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1950152" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="proscarabeus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403945"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="proscarabeus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Shalimar-Eau-de-Parfum-53.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shalimar Eau de Parfum"title="Shalimar Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1950152ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1950152" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403945">proscarabeus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-12">10/12/23 10:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I usually like powdery scents, but this one is just too musky. It is not bad, just it is not for me. It reminds me of the musk from arabic perfumes.Unfortunately ( like every  diptyque ) it  dries down quickly. It tures to a woody and very sweet scent on me. It is very unique. The longevity could be better, this is the only reason why i  do not buy diptyque. Otherwise i love this comoany.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1950152"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1950152#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1945522" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1945522" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="duckybubs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853073"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1853073.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="duckybubs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Tabac-28-Miami-54784.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54784.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tabac 28 Miami"title="Tabac 28 Miami"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1945522ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1945522" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853073">duckybubs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-06">10/06/23 09:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fresh, summery, yet woodsy dance. The longevity of the EDP is lovely, and in humid climates / spring+summer it allows for the scent to feel refreshing and intriguing. As someone who leans far more wood/leather/creamy in my fragrance collection, this is a different take for me. one of my favorites from the old lady perfume house!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1945522"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1945522#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1944635" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1944635" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sullymato"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1659667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1659667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sullymato" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1944635ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1944635" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1659667">sullymato</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-05">10/05/23 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orpheon is just a beauty. It is very much masculine, but in the most delicate and beautiful way possible.<br />
This is what I imagine the White Witch in Naria smelled like when she offered turkish delight to Edmund. That icy, dominant, but haunting and beautiful aura mixed in with the powdery sweetness of a tray of turkish delight.<br />
Stunning. absolutely worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1944635"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1944635#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941473" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1941473" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="guidosmell"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1832014"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1832014.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="guidosmell" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1941473ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1941473" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1832014">guidosmell</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-01">10/01/23 00:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells lovely, fresh + clean - leans slightly more masculine.  Juniper berry and pine dominant on me, but in a comforting clean way rather than icy/harsh due to balance with powdery notes and a lovely hint of tonka in the base. Soapy in a good way. Slightly veering on 'blue' frag territory but there's definitely more to it. Looking forward to testing this one more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1941473"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1941473#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1940474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1667105">raesmells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-29">09/29/23 13:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh man this is beautiful❤️❤️❤️I understand the raves completely now👍🏻 I read a few times that people thought this smelled like Fleur de Peau and I really wasn’t understanding it, but now that I actually sample it on my skin I do. If you like Fleur de Peau but maybe find it just a bit too odd, or may be a bit too feminine or sweet to try this one. It has that same clean powderyness but without that odd note that I sometimes find myself wondering about. I find Peau to be feminine leaning but Orpheon more masculine. I love both, and I think going back-and-forth between the two could satisfy me forever.Orpheon  is definitely on the herbal green pine tree end of powdery, whereas FdeP is on the make up powder brush side.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1939314" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pantburk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1849388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1849388.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pantburk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1939314ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1939314" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1849388">pantburk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-28">09/28/23 07:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got the solid version of this, and i've really come to love it. It really brings out the wood notes and warms them up, plus the longevity is excellent (although the trade off is that there's next to zero sillage, the solid sits Very close to the skin). I find myself sniffning my wrists constantly when wearing this. Clean, woody, and unique, but still super wearable</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1939314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1939314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1938736" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1938736" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="muguet21"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/805900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="muguet21" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1938736ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1938736" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/805900">muguet21</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-27">09/27/23 11:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vintage, clean scent. One for the introverts, in my book! The imagery I get is drinking an apéro while taking a bath before going out to a small, intimate restaurant. Reminiscent of Crabtree and Evelyn's Nantucket due to the powder notes, but in a more elevated way. I'd say this is a ageless/timeless scent, and a unisex one although I wouldn't say this is a blind buy and perhaps more feminine-leaning.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1938736"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1938736#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1934081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1934081" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AncientModernAncient"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1815719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1815719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AncientModernAncient" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Donna-Karan/DKNY-Be-Tempted-39240.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39240.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="DKNY Be Tempted"title="DKNY Be Tempted"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1934081ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1934081" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1815719">AncientModernAncient</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-21">09/21/23 20:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orphéon. It's always been Orphéon.<br />
<br />
I love everything from Diptyque, but this one is something special. On me, it's more wood than anything, somehow both warm and fresh all at once. I don't get much jasmine (thankfully) but if I concentrate I can find a hazy, lazy note buried deep. To me there's a little incense in it, maybe the tonka + cedar? It's currently battling out Tokyomilk Dark's Bulletproof for my signature scent and it's winning. I will wear this at any time, anywhere. Androgynous, introverted, divine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1934081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1934081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1928820" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1928820" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melmangia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1648706"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melmangia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-Eau-Premiere-2015-31172.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31172.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 Eau Premiere (2015)"title="Chanel No 5 Eau Premiere (2015)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1928820ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1928820" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1648706">Melmangia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-15">09/15/23 15:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the only perfume where I’ve personally experienced the chameleon scent effect.  My experience has varied drastically each time I’ve used it.  I’ve loved it and hated it, but when I’ve loved it it’s been absolutely gorgeous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1928820"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1928820#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1924510" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1924510" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lemqua"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777250"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1777250.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lemqua" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1924510ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1924510" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777250">lemqua</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-10">09/10/23 10:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this perfume is soo confusing to me. a part of me thought i'd love this based on the notes and description from others of a "cool girl you meet in a jazz club in germany unisex scent etc etc" but i wanted to start with a small sample first. and i'm glad i did because i honestly can't tell what this smells like. i can't even tell if i like it or not. at the first introduction the only thought i had was that this was something an abercrombie employee with rbf would wear. it's definitely mature and to me, slightly masculine. on second introduction i started to like it more but only in the bottle. it's like as soon as i put it on, it transforms into something indescribable and i know that's partly due to my body chemistry. the main notes fade away after awhile and leave behind something i don't quite like. sad :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1924510"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1924510#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="65738" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1616134" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1616134" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="glamoire"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545926"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1545926.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="glamoire" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1616134ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1616134" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545926">glamoire</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-03">08/03/22 09:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So, full transparency: this is my signature scent, so this review will not be objective. (Full objectivity is near-impossible with fragrances, since scent, emotion, and memory are so inextricably twined together, but I digress.)<br />
<br />
I've owned Orpheon since March 2022 and will likely need to buy another bottle before the year is over; I wear it probably four days out of every week. There are very few occasions for which I would not reach for it. Its sillage and staying power are both above average on skin, and on clothing, it's near-eternal. It announces its presence, but not too loudly; I've gotten more compliments on this scent than any other I own, but almost all of those have come from people who were standing near enough to touch me. This is one of the best fragrances Diptyque has to offer; it's underrated and a standout in their permanent collection, which is saying something. I feel confident in saying that Orpheon is a true masterpiece.<br />
<br />
For me, fragrance is an intensely personal thing that is part of my identity itself. Like a favorite shade of lipstick or that pair of jeans that always fits perfectly, it's something I can do in the course of a day to feel...well, more like me. That's because scents have a distinctly unique power to be at once grounding and transformative; a newly-discovered scent can take you on an unplanned journey, but it can also bring you home to yourself. With every new experience we have, we will interpret the world a bit differently, but there is a core part of us that stays the same. (You can't step in the same river twice, but the river itself is always made of water.) This is why a fragrance that once smelled wonderful to us can become cloying or upsetting, and why a scent that once seemed grimace-inducing may gain more depth and appeal with time, or even become an unexpected favorite.<br />
<br />
Orpheon is one of those fragrances that takes on new dimension each time I smell it, even though the feeling of nostalgia it evokes is always present. The juniper is bright and incisive in the opening, though not so aggressively sharp that it stings; it is the pleasant, bracing burn of the first sip of a strong gin &amp; tonic. That initial juniper hit is immediately tempered by wisps of smoky jasmine, as if a stranger has just brushed past you and you get a whiff of their perfume, as well as hints of the cigarette they just had outside. Then those notes quiet down as they're joined by a soft, powdery companion - it might be the subtle, familiar waft of the blush worn by an old friend, who kisses your cheek as they arrive. Their scent triggers an automatic sense of comfort; your whole body seems to relax as you begin to tell each other about recent happenings in your lives, the conversation growing quieter and more intimate as night falls outside. That's when dim, warm lighting comes on over rich, polished cedar, a note which you realize you've been smelling from the very start; but it melds seamlessly in the background, and only steps forward when you intentionally seek it out.<br />
<br />
Orpheon is at once familiar and unexpected, encapsulating both old memories and new encounters; it is an olfactory reminder of one's core self, as well as a firmly gentle nudge towards growth and change. It is a mysterious, bewildering, grounding, reassuring contradiction of a fragrance. Like life itself, this fragrance is cohesive despite its complexity, or perhaps because of it. It's impossible to know for sure, but I believe I will be wearing Orpheon for years to come.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1616134"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1616134#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1673756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1673756" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="viktorijavla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1277843"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1277843.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="viktorijavla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-EAUX-Primordiales/Ambre-Superfluide-62853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Superfluide"title="Ambre Superfluide"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1673756ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1673756" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1277843">viktorijavla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-25">10/25/22 06:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love it so much. Love from the first sniff.<br />
<br />
Smells like doing laundry in the middle of piney forest. Lasting power - eternal on clothes, ~8h on the skin.<br />
Maybe it's not suitable for cold weather, but I don't care. I will wear it whenever I want. <br />
<br />
Smells very clean, but not like soap, more like powder mixed with something woody.<br />
<br />
I am glad that it's so unpopular lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1673756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1673756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1864800" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1864800" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Duckling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1774366"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Duckling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1864800ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1864800" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1774366">Duckling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-26">06/26/23 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You’ve heard of dirty hippies, but what about clean hippies? <br />
<br />
Introducing Orpheon - the aging hippie who showers at least twice a day with some very fancy soap.<br />
<br />
I’m totally here for it. <br />
<br />
UPDATE: Yup, this is my new signature scent :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1864800"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1864800#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1359215" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1359215" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="queenysy1457"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1350563"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="queenysy1457" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1359215ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1359215" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1350563">queenysy1457</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-13">06/13/21 06:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I literally fall in love with this perfume right after I smelled it. I dare to say, it is my fate to buy Orphéon.<br />
It smells like a clean soap, and powdery.<br />
Actually, English is not my first language so I have some trouble with expressing the image of Orphéon, but I can tell that you will never regret buying this and fall in love with it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1359215"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1359215#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1306300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1306300" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emerson10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="emerson10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/ALTAIA/Don-t-Cry-For-Me-32343.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32343.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Don't Cry For Me"title="Don't Cry For Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1306300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1306300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550">emerson10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-11">03/11/21 22:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Orpheon! It's the perfect skin scent. <br />
<br />
It accomplishes the middle ground between Fleur de Peau and Glossier You. Where Fleur de Peau skews a little papery, chalky and Glossier You gets a little boozy, Orpheon got it right. It feels like an homage to both. It's got a powdery papery vibe, with a subtle sweet spiciness that doesn't veer into boozy territory, and warmed by a nice very background soft woodiness. It dries down in a kind of peppery, almost slightly aldehydic, animalic way from the jasmine. How do I explain that this dry down is just perfection?!<br />
<br />
If Fleur De Peau and Glossier You were almost right for you, but not quite there, try Orpheon. <br />
<br />
WHO I PICTURE THIS ON:<br />
Honestly feels very unisex, and I have visions of all NYers smelling like this in 2 years like they currently do of Santal 33. I feel like this will be the scent of Soho House very soon.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1306300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1306300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="65738" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">

Unisex leaning masculine. The juniper is kind of screechy, gives me a headache to the point of being a scrubber. I’ve sampled 7 fragrances from diptyque so far and all but one (Tam Dao) gave me a headache. Not usually this sensitive at all</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1532280"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1532280#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1703081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1611678">panoraifu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-06">12/06/22 01:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like that aunt who comes to your father's name day celebration and gives you, a child, a red smear on the cheek with her kiss, which she then tries to clean up using her handkerchief, which smells of saliva. I appreciate the nostalgic value, but that's about it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1703081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1703081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1310487" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1310487" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="colorfulmess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1047543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="colorfulmess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Christos-81631.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81631.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Christos"title="Christos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1310487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1310487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047543">colorfulmess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-19">03/19/21 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm perplexed by this one. It's nothing like the description. I only get a one-note tartness, similar to perfumes with chrysanthemum. I can't smell any of the other scents described by reviewers. It must be highly dependent on skin chemistry. I wish Diptyque would have gone in a different direction. The inspiration here is the "perfumers themselves" which is like navel-gazing. I have no reason to care about the bar next to the original shop.<br />
<br />
Update: I tried it a second time and keep getting a paint thinner or paint stripper smell. It's truly nauseating. My last test was on my husband and he said it smells like a gross bar at the end of the night, which made me laugh. "Close enough"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1310487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1310487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1365864" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Smells identical to La Panthere by Cartier after 10 mins which I don't like.<br />
for short : smells like incense</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1365864"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1365864#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1742477" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1742477" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Neverapeoplepleaser"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664252"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1664252.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Neverapeoplepleaser" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Hindu-Kush-49030.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49030.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hindu Kush"title="Hindu Kush"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1742477ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1742477" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664252">Neverapeoplepleaser</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-24">01/24/23 16:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Possibly the most disappointing blind buy, ever. I have alot of perfumes. I appreciate a weird variety of fragrances. However, I'm getting practically nothing from this. Slight BO odor on the dry down and just alcohol on first spray. I have quite a few Diptyque testers and like pretty much all of them. What's going on with Orpheon?<br />
It has such glowing reviews though...I'm wondering if I have a dud?! Never happened to me before. Is this possible? I've practically doused myself in this and can smell barely anything. Absolute tear inducing waste if hard earned cash.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="65738"comment_id="1742477"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html?ccid=1742477#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="65738" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x250" id="fragranticacom_perfume_mrec_1" v-pre>
</div>
        
        <div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">
        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/m.65738.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>
        <a href="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html#cc2371449"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Diptyque</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Orphéon Eau de Parfum</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="Second review: I keep returning to Orphéon as a tonic for all the samey ambrofix / santal minimalist niches and vanilla-heavy designer frags. It puts a beautiful spin on the &#039;your skin but better&#039; style by giving an airy woodland vibe. It smells like radiant skin after you&#039;ve spent...">by
            <em>BeauBleue</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.1223146.jpg"
                                                     style="width: 2em; height: 2em; border-radius: 1em"></span>
    </div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">
        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/m.36830.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>
        <a href="/perfume/Victoria-s-Secret/Pink-Pummelo-36830.html#cc2371448"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Victoria's Secret</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Pink Pummelo</span>
        </a>

            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Armaf/Club-de-Nuit-Intense-Man-34696.html" class="en2inter">Club de Nuit Intense Man Armaf</a>
        </span>
    </div>

        </div>

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
